page.title: 10Longnor Watermill
page.content: The watermill in Longnor is owned by Philip Kidd. The age of the mill is not known but it is thought to have been a button factory to start with. It is built of sandstone ripping and used to have three storeys but a fire in the 1920s destroyed the top storey. The fire is thought to have been started by some gypsies. The mill stands on the River Manifold which is dammed up with sandstone about 200 metres up stream. From the mill dam a mill race stretches to the mill. It is about 2 metres wide near the dam and 6 metres wide near the mill. It was dug out by a hy mac when Mr. Kidd took over the mill because it had been silted up. There are two outlets along the mill race, one of which is called the Treacle Spout. The wall of the mill race is leaking.
